user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space:
```c
static void
handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space (struct MHD_Connection *c,
                                     const char *chunk_size_line,
                                     size_t chunk_size_line_size)
{
  unsigned int err_code;

  if (NULL != chunk_size_line)
  {
    const char *semicol;
    /* Check for chunk extension */
    semicol = memchr (chunk_size_line, ';', chunk_size_line_size);
    if (NULL != semicol)
    { /* Chunk extension present. It could be removed without any loss of the
         details of the request. */
      transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                      MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE,
                                      ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_EXT_TOO_BIG);
    }
  }
  err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
explanation: The only potential unreachable-code concern in this function stems from the interaction with transmit_error_response_static: if that function is non-returning (noreturn/terminating), then any code following its call would be unreachable. Therefore the inner transmit_error_response_static call (inside the semicol check) and the subsequent err_code assignment + final transmit call are flagged for investigation. No other constructs in this function indicate unreachable code: there are no early returns, no constant-condition branches, no infinite loops or jumps that would make other statements unreachable. If transmit_error_response_static is confirmed to return normally, then the flagged fragments are not unreachable and no further investigation is needed for this function.
